comments: Define the sequence S(a_0,a_1) by a_{n+2} is the least integer such that a_{n+2}/a_{n+1}>a_{n+1}/a_n for n >= 0. This is S(1,4).a(n) is the number of compositions of n when there are 4 types of ones. - _Milan Janjic_, Aug 13 2010a(n)/a(n-1) tends to (5 + sqrt(13))/2 = 4.30277563... . - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jul 30 2013a(n) counts closed walks on K_2 containing four loops on the index vertex and one loop on the other. formula: A member of the family of sequences defined by a(n) = (a_1+1)a(n-1) - (a_1-1)a(n-2). Alternatively, invert A007052 (invert: define b by 1+Sum a(n)x^n = 1/(1 - Sum b(n)x^n)).a(n+1)a(n+1) - a(n+2)a(n) = -3^n, n > 0. - Douglas Rogers, Jul 11 2004O.g.f.: (1-x)/(1-5*x+3*x^2). - _R. J.
